H0.text: Radioactive elements are the only type of elements capable of changing into different elements.

H1.text: Noble gases are the only type of elements capable of changing into different elements.

H2.text: Metalloids are the only type of elements capable of changing into different elements.

H3.text: Adjacent elements are the only type of elements capable of changing into different elements.

A4.text: Rutherford and his student Frederick Soddy were the first to realize that many decay processes resulted in the transmutation of one element to another.

A5.text: Beta decay transforms a neutron into a proton or vice versa.

A6.text: A radionuclide is a nuclide that is unstable and known to undergo radioactive decay into a different nuclide.

A7.text: Secondary radionuclides are radiogenic isotopes derived from the decay of primordial radionuclides.

A8.text: The emission of an alpha particle followed by two beta particles led to the formation of an element chemically identical to the initial element but with a mass four units lighter and with different radioactive properties.

A9.text: The alpha-decay of uranium-235 forms thorium-231, whereas the beta decay of actinium-230 forms thorium-230.
